value.title: Use your browser to edit your Power BI dataset within Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: More Power BI Desktop capabilities are heading to the service. Modeling in the web is the latest addition. Now Mac users can enjoy editing capabilities! Emily joins us to tell us more!  Edit your data model in the Power BI Service (Preview) https://powerbi.microsoft.com/blog/edit-your-data-model-in-the-power-bi-service-public-preview-opt-in/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2bGb0QCLebw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)
value.excerpt: Just an end user of Power BI? Consuming reports and not authoring at all? Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports. Jump in and get familiar with reports in Power BI!  Reports in Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/end-user-reports  View a report in the Power BI service

value.title: Why can't I use Microsoft Fabric?
value.excerpt: You've heard about all the great things with Microsoft Fabric, but you don't see it in the portal. You only see the Power BI items and no persona switcher. What's going on? Adam shows you to enable Fabric for your tenant.  Enable Microsoft Fabric for your organization https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/admin/fabric-switch

value.title: Why can't Power BI connect to my cloud source???
value.excerpt: You have a cloud data source like Azure SQL Database. Why can't Power BI connect to it? They are both in the cloud! Adam shows you some things to consider and options you have! value.title: Working with Slowly Changing Dimensions in Power BI

value.title: Working with Time Periods in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do you work with time periods in Power BI like last month? Patrick digs in to show how you can accomplish this with a little DAX. value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks
value.excerpt: If you want to export the data of a Power BI table, you have options such as copy and paste, or putting it in a visual and export it. However, there is an easier way available too. You can use Power BI Helper (free tool) to export the entire data of the table. The instruction below explains how it is

value.title: Import Azure Active Directory Users into Power BI   An Step toward Dynamic Row Level Security
value.excerpt: A question that I often get when I explain what the dynamic row-level security in Power BI is and how it works, is that; how can we get all the users in an Active Directory tenant imported into Power BI? There are other benefits also to import Azure Active Directory (AAD) users loaded into Power BI for

value.title: Power BI DAX   Previous Month to Date, Quarter to Date, and Year to Date Calculations
value.excerpt: If you want to compare the sales up to a particular day and compare it with the previous period (month, quarter, or year) but up to that particular day in that period, then it is called previous month-to-date, previous quarter-to-date, and previous year-to-date. These calculations can be more helpful

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh and Hybrid Tables
value.excerpt: The default configuration for the Power BI dataset is to wipe out the entire data and reload it again. This can be a long process if you have a big dataset. Hybrid tables in Power BI keep part of the data in DirectQuery, and the rest is imported for data freshness and performance. In this video, I explain
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2husIX__ZWg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Visualization Tip   Change to Filter instead of highlight   Control the Interaction in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI reports are highly interactive, If you select a column in a column chart other charts will be highlighted. value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt
